question.text: Decomposition of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> follows a first order reaction. In fifty minutes the concentration of <math> <mrow> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </math> decreases from <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mn>0.5</mn></mrow> </math> to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mn>0.125</mn><mi> M</mi></mrow> </math> in one such decomposition. When the concentration of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> reaches <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mn>0.05</mn><mi> M</mi></mrow> </math> , the rate of formation of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> will be:

options.text: <math><mn>2.66</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">min</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></mrow></mrow></math>

<math><mn>1.34</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

<math><mn>6.93</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

<math><mn>6.93</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

solution.text:
H 2 O 2 → H 2 O+ 1 2 O 2

-d[H2O2]dt=d[H2O]dt=2d[O2]dt



t12=25

t 1 2 = 0.69314 k

k =  0.69314 25

rate of reaction = k[H2O2]

∴ d[O2]dt=12×k[H2O2]

=12×0.6931425×0.05

=6.93×10-4 mol min-1
